content: It's sometimes tedious to give all hypotheses a decent name (and I don't always like the default names that Lean comes up with.) So it's tempting to reuse names, as in have h := h.1. I expect Lean to use the latest definition whenever a variable occur more than once in the context, and my observation so far is consistent with my expectation. But is that what it really does?
Yes, it uses the one it finds first, which is the one you defined last.
Note though that if you're really done with the old h you can replace h := h.1. You don't really want your local context becoming too big.
